data.title: 2022 TV premiere dates: Complete guide to new and returning shows
data.meta_description: Here's your guide to December's TV premiere dates, including 'Yellowstone' prequel '1923,' 'Knives Out' sequel 'Glass Onion,' 'Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan,' and 'Kindred.'
data.text:
2022 may be down to its final month, but the networks and streamers have plenty of shows to unveil before the clock strikes New Year's Eve.

The guessing game resumes with Netflix's Knives Out sequel Glass Onion, the Yellowstone empire expands on Paramount+ with prequel 1923, and George Jones and Tammy Wynette step back into the spotlight for Showtime's George & Tammy. Elsewhere, Apple TV+ and Amazon Prime Video build intrigue with season 2 of Slow Horses and season 3 of Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, while FX takes you back to a 19th-century plantation for its adaptation of acclaimed novel Kindred. In addition, HBO Max's Doom Patrol, Peacock's Baking It!, and Netflix's Emily in Paris return with new episodes.

What else awaits? Scroll down to see all the premiere info for the key shows that are headed your way at the end of 2022—and to peek ahead at what's premiering in 2023, head over here.
